title: Brotherhood events
description: Run your share of the (Monday Meeting) 8-12 weekly fun events/competitions with your Sigma class

title: Epsilon Interviews
description: Interview/meet with at least 90% of Epsilons. Ask them: 1. why they joined SigEp, 2. favorite SigEp experience/memory, 3. 1 thing they would like to see from the Sigma class / chapter this semester. Note, can be up to 4 people per meeting (i.e. 2 sigmas & 2 epsilons), does not all have to be individual meetings (though those are preferred)

title: 10 PNMs
description: Meet & introduce at least 10 new (male) friends/PNMs to other Sigmas/Phis (i.e. bring to study hours, lunches)

title: >=66% event attendance
description: Event participation - attend 2/3 SB, 2/3 SM, 2/3 service, 2/3 social events

title: Sigma Sorority Serenades
description: Sing to sororities with your Sigma Brothers

title: Meet a professor
description: Introduce yourself to at least one professor, discuss your performance in the class, establish a relationship

title: 10+ Sigma homeworks
description: Complete at least 10 Sigma homework assignments across 2 modules

title: 10+ Sigma attendance
description: Attend at least 10 Sigma module classes

title: 6+ Sigma punctuality
description: Be on time/early to at least 6 Sigma module classes

title: Values 'caught'
description: Earn 1 positive and receive no more than 2 negative 'values catchings' (2 negatives = automatic fail and potentially kicked out of chapter)

title: Dinner captain
description: Do your share of the 12ish Monday meeting dinners per semester that are split among the Phi class

title: 2 PNM Intros
description: Introduce 2+ PNMs to other Phis/Sigmas

title: 8 PNM Meetings
description: Meet with 8+ PNMs (that the Sigmas/other brothers introduce to you - basically just hang out with Sigmas and their PNMs)

title: >=50% event attendance
description: Event participation - attend 1/2 SB, 1/2 SM, 1/2 Com. Service, 1/2 social events

title: Lead (development) events
description: Do your share of successfully leading/throwing 8-16 Phi events led each semester (2-4 each of Sound Body, Sound Mind, Service, Social). Phis are broken into teams of 3 and for each event, 1 person each is in charge of: 1. logistics/planning, 2. attendance, 3. feedback/follow up (values + fun ratings). A 'successful event' must have at least 50% attendance and earn at least a 7 on values and 7 on fun based on ratings by at least 33% of the attendees.

title: Bench press
description: Bench press your body weight

title: Push-ups
description: Do 25 consecutive 3 second push-ups (3 seconds down, 1 second up)

title: Leg press
description: Leg press 1.5x your body weight

title: Pistol squats
description: Do 5 consecutive 'half pistol squats' - one legged squats to 90 degrees (parallel to the ground)

title: 2 Group X classes
description: Take 2 different classes (i.e. Group X classes at the RSF) on new forms of fitness / body movement - i.e. yoga, pilates, crossfit, parkour, gymnastics

title: Physical exam
description: Get measured on your blood pressure, body fat, heart rate, cholesterol, blood trackers, etc. (i.e. http://insidetracker.com )

title: $100 Philanthropy
description: Raise $100 for philanthropy (raising for SigEp group philanthropy events such as Pedal for Life counts toward this total)

title: Sober / values brother
description: Be a sober / upholder of high values standards at a SigEp event (typically social events such as parties or exchanges where values can be more easily compromised by brothers OR guests)

title: 10+ Phi homeworks
description: Complete at least 10 Phi homework assignments across 2 modules

title: 10+ Phi attendance
description: Attend at least 10 Phi module classes

title: 6+ Phi punctuality
description: Be on time/early to at least 6 Phi module classes

title: Sigma performance review
description: Hold Sigma values performance review with the Phi class

title: Vision/values chapter presentation
description: Do presentation on chapter vision and values with your Phi class

title: Sigma Mentoring
description: mentoring - ensure your mentee(s) completes Sigma (mid-way review to see if you're both on track and final review to debrief) OR mentor/lead a development module (numbers wise there may be more Phis than Sigmas, in which case Phis who do not have Sigma mentees will mentor the Sigma Challenge itself as a group/leaders)

title: Values 'caught'
description: Earn 2 positives and receive no more than 2 negative 'values catchings' (2 negatives = automatic fail and potentially kicked out of chapter)

title: Student club
description: Be an active member in at least 1 other Cal student organization/group

title: 5 pull ups
description: Do 5 dead hang (no kipping or momentum) pull-ups

title: 5 pistol squats
description: Do 5 one-legged, full (to 1 inch from the ground but NOT touching the ground) pistol squats

title: Date night
description: Work with other Epsilons to cook and host an etiquette dinner with dates

title: Recruit faculty member
description: recruit a professor or faculty member to help with a SigEp event or program (or be a mentor)

title: IM sports
description: particpate on at least 1 SigEp IM team

title: Personal fear / weakness
description: face personal fear / weakness (personally set self-development goal)

title: New skill
description: learn new (SM or SB) skill, i.e. martial ats, cooking, salsa dancing, public speaking

title: Network with 3 professional contacts
description: networking - reach out to 3 professional contacts & set up meetings / talks with them or shadow them

title: 3 famous people
description: make a list of 3 (living) people you would most like to talk to in the world, develop a plan to contact each and attempt it

title: Dance lessons
description: go to a dance lesson or host a dance instructor at the house for brothers + dates/sorority

title: thank you notes
description: write 5 thank you notes to people who have helped you over the past year as well as your parents/family

title: politics
description: research a topic then vote on it OR attend a local city or college poltical mtg

title: SM & SB Olympics
description: Work with a group of 3-6 Epsilons. Goal / vision: Turn SM & SB Olympics into a 'values weekend' where all the core values are celebrated and members are recognized who excel and/or have shown improvement in more or more of them

title: Pedal for Life
description: Work with a group of 3-6 Epsilons. Goal / vision: Turn Pedal for Life into an annual alumni (and community) event that draws (a) hundred(s) (of) people

title: House project / cleaning CULTURE
description: Work with a group of 4-10 Epsilons. Goal / vision: Make the SigEp house a place that any mom would be proud of and that is a shining example of our values and the Balanced Man Ideal - clean, great study/academic environment, and fun - THE place any SigEp (or any person on campus) wants to be/hang out

title: Philanthropy events
description: Work with a group of 2-5 Epsilons to run 1+ Philanthropy events to raise $1000+ (i.e. Halloween Pumpkin Tabling or Valentine's Roses Tabling)

title: Alumni events
description: Work with a group of 2-6 Epsilons to run 1-3 alumni events that get 15+ total alumni (typically better in Fall since they can be paired with Football tailgates and in the Spring we already have SM & SB Olympics and PFL which are our 2 biggest alumni events).

title: Alumni contact/relations
description: reach out to 3+ alums to get updates on their life (& then ask to put them in the newsletter) and start to get to know them, invite them to SigEp events, and start to build a relationship. Ideally contact people in your career field who you'd like to stay in contact with

title: Self 10-80-10
description: Move yourself out of the bottom 10% or into the top 10% for one of the core SigEp values (i.e. take 1 piece of the 'Ideal SigEp' Balanced Man & set & achieve a SMART goal for moving yourself closer to the Balanced Man Ideal)

title: Mentee 10-80-10
description: Help move your mentee out of the bottom 10% or into the top 10% for one of the core SigEp values

title: 5+ PNMs to SigEp
description: introduce at least 5 PNMs to SigEp (that Sigmas/Phis introduce to you - basically hang out with Sigmas/Phis and their PNMs and invite 5 tops ones to SigEp events - Monday meetings, Sound Body events, etc.)

title: Sigma/Phi Mentoring
description: mentor a younger member (Sigma or Phi) and ensure he succeeds in his Challenge (mid-way review to see if you're both on track and final review to debrief) OR mentor/lead a development module (numbers wise there may be more mentors than Phis and Sigmas, in which case Epsilons who do not have mentees will mentor the Sigma/Phi Challenges themselves as a group/leaders)

title: take 1 (elective) module
description: Epsilon begins the branching out to specific interests; you take the last required module and now transition into taking custom modules

title: >=33% event attendance
description: Event participation - attend 1/3 SB, 1/3 SM, 1/3 service, 1/3 social events

title: PFL, raise $150
description: Participate (bike) in Pedal for Life and raise $150 for the cause

title: Community Mentor Recruitment Prep
description: form 'specific ask' for SigEp alumni/community mentor, make a list of and reach out to at least 3 potential candidates to start building a relationship. You'll choose and formally ask/recruit 1 of them at the start of the Brother Mentor Challenge

title: Values catching
description: 'I caught ya' game - catch 4 poeple (Sigmas or Phis) positively exemplifying our values. Catch 1 person (Sigma or Phi) who is NOT exemplifying (or going against) our values. For BOTH the positive and negatives, confront (either praise or give constructive criticism) the person and communicate it as such. Transparency, openness, honesty, and immediate feedback are paramount here and this feedback is what ensures we always uphold the values of our organization and push it forward.

title: Alumni involvement
description: reach out to 3+ alumni and discuss ways they could get involved with the chapter and/or invite them out to an alumni event. If there are no upcoming alumni events, host one.

title: AVC Board / Senior Checklist
description: attend an AVC mtg and talk to them about staying involved after graduation OR update the senior checklist and ensure 3+ seniors do all items on it prior to graduation

title: SigEp Bucket List
description: compile / add to the 'SigEp bucket list' / 'events bank' of all things a student/SigEp should do before graduation

title: Volunteer Recruitment
description: recruit a volunteer to help the chapter (alumni, faculty, community member)

title: Vision/Values Implementation
description: take 1 piece of the 5 year vision and set & achieve a SMART goal for making progress toward it

title: Travel for a community service project
1 SMART goal
description: Set and achieve 1 (SM or SB) SMART Goal

title: Take a development module
description: Take at least one (elective) development module

title: Lead a development module
description: create & run a new development module OR lead an existing development module

title: Epsilon Mentoring
description: Mentor an Epsilon

title: >=33% event attendance
description: Event participation - attend 1/3 SB, 1/3 SM, 1/3 service, 1/3 social events

title: 2 muscle-ups + 15 second flag + 6:30 mile
description: Complete 2 muscle-ups, hold a 'human/ab flag' for 15 seconds, and run a sub 6:30 mile

title: 10 pull-ups + 45 push-ups + 60 squats + 6:00 mile
description: Complete 10 consecutive dead-hang (no kipping) pull-ups, 45 consecutive push-ups, 60 consecutive 90-degree air squats, and run a sub 6:00 mile

title: 50 burpees + 6:00 mile
description: Complete 50 conseutive burpees and run a sub 6:00 mile
